intro: Jaborosa floccosa, commonly known as the woolly jaborosa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellowish flowers. Jaborosa floccosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
